author: @gurufocus
title: TrustBIX Inc. Announces Stock Option Grant | TBIXF Stock News
text:
- TrustBIX Inc. (TSXV: TBIX) has approved the grant of stock options to purchase up to 4,120,000 common shares.
- The options are priced at $0.05 per share and have a three-year expiration period.
- The vesting schedule allows one-third to vest immediately, one-third after one year, and the final third after two years.
TrustBIX Inc. (TSXV: TBIX), an emerging leader in agricultural technology, has announced a significant move to incentivize its leadership and workforce by granting stock options, a decision ratified by its Board of Directors. These stock options permit the purchase of up to 4,120,000 common shares at an exercise price of $0.05 each. This strategic financial maneuver is set to strengthen the company's alignment with its directors, officers, employees, and consultants.
The granted stock options come with a structured vesting schedule. One-third of these options will vest immediately upon grant. The vesting will continue with another third available on the first anniversary of the grant, and the remaining third on the second anniversary. This staggered vesting is designed to enhance long-term commitment and performance incentives for TrustBIX's pivotal team members.
With a three-year expiration period, these stock options provide ample time for the holders to exercise their rights, positioning TrustBIX to continue its mission of providing Gate to PlateÂ® solutions that advocate for trusting more, wasting less, and supporting sustainable practices within the agri-food industry.
TrustBIX's core innovations and technologies are recognized as reliable tools for both local and international agri-food communities, underscoring the company's commitment to sustainability and efficiency. As the financial landscape evolves, TrustBIX remains agile, ensuring that its strategies support the company's growth and its stakeholders' interests.

author: Investing.com
title: Eyenovia suspende estudio sobre miopÃ­a tras no alcanzar el objetivo primario Por Investing.com
text:
NUEVA YORK - Eyenovia, Inc. (NASDAQ: EYEN), una empresa biofarmacÃ©utica especializada en terapias oftÃ¡lmicas, anunciÃ³ hoy la discontinuaciÃ³n de su estudio CHAPERONE tras una revisiÃ³n por parte de un ComitÃ© de RevisiÃ³n de Datos (DRC) independiente. El ensayo clÃ­nico de Fase 3, que evaluaba la eficacia de la combinaciÃ³n fÃ¡rmaco-dispositivo patentada por Eyenovia para el tratamiento de la miopÃ­a progresiva pediÃ¡trica, no logrÃ³ cumplir con el objetivo primario de eficacia.
El DRC, tras examinar los datos de seguridad y eficacia de 252 pacientes, concluyÃ³ que no existÃ­a una diferencia significativa en la progresiÃ³n de la miopÃ­a entre los dos grupos de tratamiento activo y el grupo placebo. A pesar de estos resultados, el anÃ¡lisis de seguridad indicÃ³ que todas las dosis, incluido el placebo, fueron bien toleradas, registrÃ¡ndose solo eventos adversos leves e infrecuentes.
Michael Rowe, CEO de Eyenovia, expresÃ³ su decepciÃ³n con el resultado, pero agradeciÃ³ a los participantes y profesionales de la salud involucrados en el ensayo. La empresa ahora se dispone a realizar una revisiÃ³n exhaustiva de los datos y considerar opciones estratÃ©gicas que podrÃ­an incluir una combinaciÃ³n de negocios, fusiÃ³n inversa o venta de activos.
La cartera actual de Eyenovia incluye tratamientos para el dolor y la inflamaciÃ³n postquirÃºrgicos, asÃ­ como para la midriasis, aprovechando su plataforma de dispensaciÃ³n Optejet. Esta plataforma estÃ¡ diseÃ±ada para mejorar la seguridad, facilidad de uso y potencialmente aumentar el cumplimiento en el tratamiento de enfermedades crÃ³nicas de la parte anterior del ojo.
La empresa tambiÃ©n cuenta con acuerdos de licencia y desarrollo para indicaciones adicionales, incluyendo el ojo seco, que podrÃ­an beneficiarse de la tecnologÃ­a Optejet. Se proporcionarÃ¡n mÃ¡s detalles sobre la evaluaciÃ³n estratÃ©gica de Eyenovia una vez finalizada.
Esta noticia se basa en un comunicado de prensa y refleja los Ãºltimos desarrollos de Eyenovia con respecto a su ensayo clÃ­nico y futuras consideraciones comerciales.
En otras noticias recientes, Eyenovia ha reportado avances significativos en sus ofertas de productos y colaboraciones durante su conferencia de resultados del tercer trimestre. A pesar de registrar una pÃ©rdida neta de 7,9 millones de dÃ³lares en el tercer trimestre de 2024, la empresa estÃ¡ prÃ³xima a la lectura de datos de eficacia de Fase III para MicroPine, un producto dirigido a la miopÃ­a progresiva pediÃ¡trica. AdemÃ¡s, ha lanzado MydCombi y Clobetasol, que estÃ¡n mostrando un fuerte interÃ©s y eficacia. Eyenovia tambiÃ©n estÃ¡ desarrollando su dispositivo Optejet de segunda generaciÃ³n, prometiendo una mejor eficiencia de fabricaciÃ³n y mÃ¡rgenes de costos de hasta el 90%. Se han establecido colaboraciones con Formosa Pharmaceuticals, Senju Pharmaceuticals y SGN Nanopharma para abordar el mercado estadounidense de ojo seco, valorado en 3.000 millones de dÃ³lares. La empresa cuenta con aproximadamente 7,2 millones de dÃ³lares en efectivo, respaldados por 10,7 millones de dÃ³lares provenientes de ofertas recientes de valores. Estos son algunos de los desarrollos recientes mientras Eyenovia continÃºa expandiendo su cartera y asociaciones.
Perspectivas de InvestingPro
El reciente revÃ©s en el estudio CHAPERONE de Eyenovia ha impactado significativamente en el desempeÃ±o bursÃ¡til de la empresa. SegÃºn datos de InvestingPro, las acciones de Eyenovia han sufrido un golpe sustancial, con una caÃ­da del 30,46% en la Ãºltima semana. Esta fuerte caÃ­da coincide con el anuncio de la discontinuaciÃ³n del estudio y refleja las preocupaciones de los inversores sobre las perspectivas futuras de la empresa.
A pesar de los decepcionantes resultados del ensayo, los Tips de InvestingPro destacan que los analistas anticipan un crecimiento de las ventas para Eyenovia en el aÃ±o en curso. Esta proyecciÃ³n podrÃ­a estar relacionada con otros productos de la empresa en desarrollo, como los tratamientos para el dolor y la inflamaciÃ³n postquirÃºrgicos, que utilizan la plataforma de dispensaciÃ³n Optejet.
Sin embargo, es importante seÃ±alar que Eyenovia estÃ¡ operando actualmente con pÃ©rdidas, con un beneficio bruto negativo de 5,65 millones de dÃ³lares en los Ãºltimos doce meses. La posiciÃ³n financiera de la empresa se ve aÃºn mÃ¡s presionada por su tasa de consumo de efectivo, como indica otro Tip de InvestingPro. Esta presiÃ³n financiera puede haber contribuido a la decisiÃ³n de la direcciÃ³n de explorar opciones estratÃ©gicas, incluyendo posibles combinaciones de negocios o ventas de activos.
Para los inversores que buscan un anÃ¡lisis mÃ¡s completo, InvestingPro ofrece 20 consejos adicionales para Eyenovia, proporcionando una comprensiÃ³n mÃ¡s profunda de la salud financiera y la posiciÃ³n de mercado de la empresa en estos tiempos desafiantes.
Este artÃ­culo ha sido generado y traducido con el apoyo de AI y revisado por un editor. Para mÃ¡s informaciÃ³n, consulte nuestros T&C.

author: Harper Wright
title: La NFL fa un audace salto nell'era digitale, avanzando verso un futuro senza il "chain gang" e rivoluzionando la misurazione delle distanze in un passo storico.
text:
Abbracciare i Progressi Tecnologici
La NFL, un bastione di tradizione e storia, sta ora facendo un passo audace verso lâ€™era digitale, segnando un cambiamento significativo nel modo in cui il gioco viene giocato e arbitrato. La decisione della lega di abbracciare la tecnologia allâ€™avanguardia potrebbe potenzialmente rendere obsoleta la famosa catena, segnando un momento storico nellâ€™evoluzione del football americano.
In uno sport dove ogni centimetro conta, il metodo tradizionale di misurare il down e la distanza utilizzando due bastoni collegati da una catena Ã¨ stato un pilastro sin dalla sua nascita negli anni â€™90 dellâ€™Ottocento. Tuttavia, mentre la NFL compie progressi verso la modernizzazione, questa pratica secolare sta ora affrontando la prospettiva di essere sostituita da sistemi elettronici che promettono maggiore precisione ed efficienza.
Uno Sguardo al Passato
La vista degli arbitri che allungano meticolosamente la catena per determinare se una squadra ha raggiunto un primo down Ã¨ stata a lungo una scena familiare sui campi da football in tutto il paese. Questa pratica onorata dal tempo, intrisa di tradizione e nostalgia, Ã¨ stata una parte integrante del tessuto del gioco per oltre un secolo.
PoichÃ© fan e giocatori si sono abituati al sospense e al dramma che accompagnano ogni misurazione, la catena Ã¨ diventata un simbolo della ricca storia e dellâ€™ereditÃ  duratura del football. Eppure, mentre la NFL guarda verso il futuro, Ã¨ pronta a dire addio a questo elemento iconico in favore di tecnologie piÃ¹ avanzate e affidabili.
Rivoluzionare la Misurazione della Distanza
La decisione di introdurre sistemi elettronici per misurare i primi down rappresenta un cambiamento monumentale nel modo in cui il gioco viene arbitrato e vissuto. Sfruttando la tecnologia allâ€™avanguardia, la NFL mira a semplificare il processo di determinazione del down e della distanza, fornendo maggiore precisione ed efficienza sul campo.
Con i sistemi elettronici pronti a rivoluzionare la misurazione delle distanze, la lega non solo abbraccia lâ€™innovazione, ma stabilisce anche un nuovo standard di precisione e affidabilitÃ  nellâ€™arbitraggio del calcio. Questa mossa innovativa segna un cambiamento epocale nel modo in cui il gioco viene giocato e arbitrato, aprendo la strada a un futuro in cui il gruppo di catene potrebbe diventare un reliquia del passato.

author: Sharan Poovanna
title: Karnataka bill proposes collection of portion of earnings from temples
text:
Home Politics Karnataka bill proposes collection of portion of earnings from temples. 'Anti-Hindu', says... Politics Karnataka bill proposes collection of portion of earnings from temples. â€˜Anti-Hinduâ€™, says BJP Karnataka minister Ramalinga Reddy says revenue collected from state-run temples will be routed to corpus fund to then be utilised for betterment of priests & their families. Sharan Poovanna 23 February, 2024 09:33 am IST Facebook Twitter WhatsApp Linkedin Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah ahead of presentation of state Budget at Vidhana Soudha in Bengaluru on 16 Feb, 2024 | ANI Text Size: A- A+
Bengaluru: A bill passed late Wednesday by the Karnataka Legislative Assembly, which proposes to collect a portion of the earnings from state-run temples, has triggered a political slugfest with the Opposition Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) declaring it â€œanti-Hinduâ€.
The passing of the Karnataka Hindu Religious Institutions and Charitable Endowments Bill 2024 added to the already turbulent Budget session with the Opposition trying hard to corner the Siddaramaiah-led Congress government for tabling such a law.
In its present form, the bill proposes to collect and utilise 10 percent of the revenue of state-run temples earning more than Rs 1 crore, and 5 percent from temples with revenues between Rs 10 lakh and Rs 1 crore.
Show Full Article
The main point of contention raised by the BJP is the wording in the bill, which says that the money collected can be used for â€œother religious institutionsâ€ that are â€œpoor or in needy circumstancesâ€, and that non-Hindus can become trustees in a temple. A section of the BJP has alleged that CM Siddaramaiah has retained an element of ambiguity by not wording it as â€œHindu Religious Institutionsâ€ in order to divert funds to similar establishments in other communities, particularly Muslim.
With Lok Sabha elections round the corner, the BJP in Karnataka is intensifying its attacks on Siddaramaiah and allege appeasement politics by way of additional grants in the budget and Congress-led governments policies to secure minority vote. The BJP hopes that by â€œhighlightingâ€ such issues, it can consolidate the scattered vote of the larger Hindu community, said political leaders.
The funds collected will be moved to a corpus fund and various committees will decide on how best it can be used to fix roads, libraries and other facilities for pilgrims, according to the bill.
Karnataka BJP president B.Y. Vijayendra termed the legislation an extension of CM Siddaramaiahâ€™s â€œanti-Hindu policiesâ€, adding that the state government had spared other religions from such laws.
In a long post on X, Vijayendra said that the â€œCorrupt, inept #LootSarkaar with its penchant for anti-Hindu ideology in the guise of secularism, has cast its evil eyes on the Temple revenues. Through the Hindu Religious Endowments amendment act, it is trying to siphon off donations as well as offerings from Hindu temples and religious institutions in order to fill its empty coffersâ€¦.â€
Corrupt, inept #LootSarkaar with its penchant for anti Hindu ideology in the guise of secularism, has cast its evil eyes on the TempleğŸ›• revenues. Through the Hindu Religious Endowments amendment act, it is trying to siphon off donations as well as offerings from Hindu templesâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/Vzf9RQTaP4
â€” Vijayendra Yediyurappa (@BYVijayendra) February 22, 2024
Minister for Transport and Muzrai, Ramalinga Reddy, however, told ThePrint Thursday that such a practice has existed since 2003.
â€œFrom 2003, this practice has been prevalent. About 34,000 temples that have less than Rs 5 lakh donâ€™t have to pay anything. From Rs 5-25 lakh are â€˜B gradeâ€™ temples who had to pay 5 percent on gross (revenues). And those above Rs 10 lakh had to pay 10 percent. What we have done is removed gross (revenues) and made it net (revenues),â€ said Reddy, who is also a working president of the Karnataka Pradesh Congress Committee (KPCC).
Reddy added that the funds collected from state-run temples will be routed to a Dharmika Parishad (common pool fund) to then be utilised for the betterment of priests and their families. The money will be used for the benefit of â€˜C gradeâ€™ temples and to provide insurance and other facilities for the nearly 40,000-50,000 priests and their families, said the minister.
â€œWhen a priest dies, his family gets Rs 35,000 and now I am trying to get them insured for Rs 5 lakh which will cost Rs 6-7 crore per year (premium payments). Even if there is just one child per family, then it will cost us Rs 5-6 crore to provide scholarships. And a housing scheme. Keeping in mind the welfare of priests, we have increased the slab,â€ Reddy told ThePrint.
Also Read: Capex falls to Rs 52,903-cr in Karnataka budget, Siddaramaiah allots nearly same amount for 5 promises
Opposition criticism
In a post on X, R. Ashok, Leader of the Opposition in the state legislature, asked the Congress: â€œWhy do you hate Hindus and their temples so much?â€
â€œThe evil and greedy eyes of the Congress have now fallen on Hindu temples as they have come forward to collect 10 percent commission from them. Devotees contribute for festivals, fairs, and other celebrations and the Congress is now eyeing this money,â€ he wrote.
à²²à³‚à²Ÿà²¿à²•à³‹à²° @INCKarnataka à²¸à²°à³à²•à²¾à²°à²¦ à²µà²•à³à²°à²¦à³ƒà²·à³à²Ÿà²¿ à²ˆà²— à²¹à²¿à²‚à²¦à³‚ à²¦à³‡à²µà²¾à²²à²¯à²—à²³ à²¹à³à²‚à²¡à²¿à²¯ à²®à³‡à²²à³‚ à²¬à²¿à²¦à³à²¦à²¿à²¦à³à²¦à³, à²¦à³‡à²µà²¾à²²à²¯à²—à²³ à²†à²¦à²¾à²¯à²¦à²²à³à²²à²¿ 10% à²•à²®à²¿à²·à²¨à³ à²ªà²¡à³†à²¯à²²à³ à²®à³à²‚à²¦à²¾à²—à²¿à²¦à³†.
à²¦à³‡à²µà²¸à³à²¥à²¾à²¨ à²•à²¾à²²à²•à²¾à²²à²•à³à²•à³† à²œà³€à²°à³à²£à³‹à²¦à³à²§à²¾à²°à²µà²¾à²—à²²à²¿, à²‰à²¤à³à²¸à²µ, à²œà²¾à²¤à³à²°à³†à²—à²³à³ à²µà²¿à²œà³ƒà²‚à²­à²£à³†à²¯à²¿à²‚à²¦ à²¨à²¡à³†à²¯à²²à²¿, à²­à²•à³à²¤à²° à²…à²¨à³à²¨ à²¦à²¾à²¸à³‹à²¹à²•à³à²•à³†, à²µà²¸à²¤à²¿ à²¨à²¿à²²à²¯à²—à²³à²¿à²—à³† à²…à²¨à³à²•à³‚à²²à²µà²¾à²—à²²à²¿ à²à²‚à²¦à³ à²­à²•à³à²¤à²°à³ à²¨à³€à²¡à³à²µâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/ZljiWnP6xF
â€” R. Ashoka (à²†à²°à³. à²…à²¶à³‹à²•) (@RAshokaBJP) February 22, 2024
The issue has attracted sharp criticisms from even central BJP leaders like Rajeev Chandrasekhar, scores of other pro-Hindu voices, as well as industry captains.
T.V. Mohandas Pai, former Infosys board member and chairman of Aarin Capital, asked the government to clarify its stand.
â€œ@CMofKarnataka @siddaramaiah @DKShivakumar Pl clarify if Non Hindus can become members of temple management committees or other committees dealing with Hindu temples under this law. @BSBommai,â€ Pai asked on X.
Stormy budget session
A two-term chief minister, Siddaramaiah has often been targeted by the BJP and its affiliated organisations as â€œanti-Hinduâ€.
From his early years in public life Siddaramaiah identified as an atheist and rationalist.
However, over the years, at least since he became CM for the first time in 2013, he began calling himself an agnostic. But in recent months, he identified as a â€œbelieverâ€ claiming to have built Ram temples in his village.
Siddaramaiah Thursday accused the BJP of spreading falsehood for â€œpolitical gainâ€ and that the provision for a common pool has been in place since 1997.
â€œThe common pool is administered solely for religious purposes connected with the Hindu religion. The Common Pool Fund has been utilised only for the religious purposes of Hindu institutions since the Act came into force in 2003, and it will continue to be used for the same purposes in the future. It has not been utilised for any other purposes or for the benefit of followers of other religions,â€ he said in a statement released to the media.
He added that the BJP were â€œmisleading the public and polarising people along communal lines for political leverageâ€.
In December last year, when accused of â€˜appeasementâ€™ by the Opposition following his statement about the governmentâ€™s plan to increase the annual budget for minorities, he had told reporters : â€œWhat is wrong with that?â€
In the Budget , presented on 16 February, the Siddaramaiah government allocated Rs 360 crore to the CMâ€™s Special Development Programme and Minorities Colony Development Programme, for the year. The Budget also had provisions for grants to other minority communities like Jains and Sikhs, besides Rs 200 crore for the overall development of Christians.
Further, the Budget also had a provision for allocation of Rs 100 crore for development of wakf properties.
What added to the political slugfest between the Congress and the BJP was the state governmentâ€™s decision to pay a compensation of Rs 15 lakh to the family of a resident of Keralaâ€™s Wayanad who was killed by a stray wild elephant collared by the Karnataka forest department.
The BJP accused Karnataka Forest Minister Eshwar Khandre of making the special concession after he was â€˜orderedâ€™ to do so by Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, who is also the Member of Parliament from Wayanad.
(Edited by Amrtansh Arora)

Chacun peut ainsi comprendre le cycle de lâ€™eau et son parcours, oÃ¹ va lâ€™eau captÃ©e et son usage, ce quâ€™est une ripisylve, forÃªt de riviÃ¨re vÃ©ritable milieu de vie pour les animauxâ€¦ Alors prÃªt Ã  â€œsavoir comment Ã§a marcheâ€ en famille ? Vous pouvez le tÃ©lÃ©charger [ici ](https://prsnet-sp.media.local/GRDC_WEB2_B/WebContentPage.aspx?key=7a138afe-9638-4d28-9113-2d93452f919e)ou le trouver chez nos diffuseurs et dans les offices de tourisme. Au sommaire du dossier

author: David Deavel
title: Not Just One Day of the Year
text:
â€œGood Friday is not just one day of the year,â€ Fr. Richard John Neuhaus writes in â€œDeath on a Friday Afternoon. â€œ â€œIt is a day relived in every day of the world, and of our lives in the world.â€
There is â€œno denying that the cross is surrounded by glory,â€ wrote Fr. Richard John Neuhaus in Death on a Friday Afternoon, his meditations on the Seven Last Words of Christ, those mysterious and sometimes puzzling statements the Gospels record him saying from the Cross. As Fr. Neuhaus continued, the Cross is itself of a mysterious and puzzling nature. â€œIt is, at the same time, the sign of utter defeat and indomitable hope. The defeat and the hope must ever be held together; the hope is not hopeful unless it has taken into account everything that contradicts hope.â€
This taste for and ability to draw out the paradoxical quality of Christian belief marked out Lutheran minister cum Catholic priest Neuhaus as a kind of successor to Chesterton. A man who was comfortable wrestling with public policy and the world of politics, Fr. Neuhaus always made it clear that such things were â€œsecond things.â€ The journal he founded, edited, and wrote (about a third of each issue was made up of his words in the back of the magazine and often in the middle, too) was titled First Things to signal that its emphasis would be not on the political horse races, the details of the bills and regulations, or the (increasingly smokeless) back rooms where the deals were made. Instead, it would be dedicated to literary, historical, philosophical, and theological realities.
This year marks the fifteenth since his passage from this life. Iâ€™ve often wondered what he would make of the increasingly strange times we live in. I suspect he would not be terribly surprised. Though he liked to say that â€œAmerica is, as it always has been, an incorrigibly, confusedly, and conflictedly Christian society,â€ his last book was titled American Babylon. A man very aware of the movement of his own time, he certainly saw the difficulties coming, but he emphasized in that volume that he was calling America Babylon â€œnot by comparison with other societies but by comparison with that radically new order sought by all who know loveâ€™s grief in refusing to settle for a community of less than truth and justice uncompromised.â€ No matter how bad or good things are at a given moment, the glory that attends this country and, indeed,this whole world will always be mixed up with that â€œutter defeat.â€
This is why those meditations in the earlier book, Death on a Friday Afternoon (2000), are so powerful. They refuse to take away the paradoxical character of Christian faith. Like all of Fr. Neuhausâ€™s writings, they may well include things we might think wrong, but, if so, it is because they deal with those first things that are the highest things. As I read this book for the first time this Lent, I reflected that if his reach sometimes exceeded his grasp, that is itself meritorious. Like St. Paul, he is writing about Christ crucified, a situation St. Paul called â€œa stumbling block to Jews and folly to Gentilesâ€ and yet is â€œthe power of God and the wisdom of God.â€ The message throughout Fr. Neuhausâ€™s volume is not to hurry our way through Good Friday on to Easter as if it were â€œsimply the dismal but necessary prelude to the joy of Easterâ€ but see it instead as â€œthe drama of the love by which our every day is sustained.â€
We Christians are an Easter people, as St. Augustine liked to say. â€œAlleluiaâ€ is indeed our song. But that loving praise to God will always be, in this life, faithful and hopeful. Faith is the assurance of what is not seen, while hope is the desire for what faith promises. If we are an Easter people, we are also a Good Friday people, one for whom the power of Christâ€™s Resurrection is giving us the ability to follow behind him, take up our own crosses, and imitate him. â€œChrist plays in ten thousand places,â€ Gerard Manley Hopkins tells us. Our own lives become a theater in which that divine drama, played out when Pontius Pilate was governor, becomes present to the world in every age thereafter.
â€œGood Friday is not just one day of the year,â€ Fr. Neuhaus tells us. â€œIt is a day relived in every day of the world, and of our lives in the world.â€ Some Christians object to the crucifix, the image of Christ on the Cross, because Christ is risen. But that image is so central not only because it reminds us of what redemption cost the Son of God made Man; it is central because it reminds us of the price that the free grace of redemption costs us. For to accept the free gift of eternal life means to be made like Christâ€”people who will follow the Fatherâ€™s will wherever it leads, even death on a cross. â€œThe truth is that Good Friday forms the spiritual architecture of Christian existence,â€ Fr. Neuhaus tells us. â€œIt is by this world, this world at the cross, that reality is judged.â€
This world tells us that our sins are nothing, really. They donâ€™t matter. Yet the one who dies, asking forgiveness for those who â€œknow not what they do,â€ shows us that our sins do matter because we matter. â€œSpare me the sentimental love,â€ Fr. Neuhaus says, â€œthat tells me what I do and what I am does not matter.â€ Our sins have separated us, â€œsunderedâ€ us, from the source of life and love. The Cross tells us that God thought that distance from us was worth something, that he wanted us to be â€œat oneâ€ with himself.
In what does that atonement consist? Fr. Neuhaus doesnâ€™t claim to explain how it happened. But he spends some time looking at modern theories that have been proposed. Liberal versions that wish to get rid of the notion that Jesus is a sacrifice have simply offered us something that is not Christianity. Paul Tillichâ€™s notion that the â€œChrist eventâ€ simply communicated the message that we are all â€œacceptedâ€ by God is, says Fr. Neuhaus, â€œfinally another form of positive thinking.â€ On the other hand, versions of a â€œsubstitutionary atonementâ€ often speak as if Christâ€™s sacrifice is something â€œGod did to Jesus.â€ A much better way to think about this is to think of Christ not simply as our â€œsubstituteâ€ but our â€œrepresentativeâ€ and remember that the Trinity is not simply a collective working together but the one God whose love is from first to last.
The entire plan is love from beginning to end, and the fullness of Godâ€”Father, Son and Spirit conspiring together to save us from ourselves. At the Fatherâ€™s command, the Son freely goes forth in the power of the Spirit to become one of us. On our behalf, as Representative Humanity, he lives the life of perfect obedience that Adamâ€”and all of us â€œin Adamâ€â€”failed to live. And he completes that life by dying the perfect death.
The sacrifice of Christ is completed on the Cross, but it is not limited to it. Christâ€™s perfect obedience was from his first human moment until eternity. Every moment of his existence was an offering to his Father. Yet there is on the Cross a kind of summing up of that sacrifice in those hours and those few sentences of his.
In the place where even God seemed hopeless, we find the grounds of our hope: forgiveness for those who know not what they do, his promise of paradise for a thief, his giving of Mary and John to each other, his cry of dereliction, his thirst, his declaration of completion, and his commendation of his Spirit to his Father.
The story of Jesus, especially the part about the Cross, is the strangest story of all time, yet, â€œ[t]hat it embraces every strangeness is testimony to its truth.â€ Unlike some books of â€œmeditations,â€ Fr. Neuhausâ€™s stretches 260 pages. Even at that, he admits, there are countless avenues that could have been explored. His book is an â€œexploration into mystery,â€ by which he means not â€œa puzzle, as in a murder mysteryâ€ but â€œan adventure into wonder, with each wonder that we encounter leading on to the next and greater wonder.â€ That is as it should be.
I recommend Fr. Neuhausâ€™s book for next Good Friday. Or, frankly, any time. For the Cross involves all time. But Christians donâ€™t even need that book to reflect. Even to read today the passages in which those immortal words spoken by one experiencing mortality is to enter into that mystery, to hear again words of life uttered in the face of death, and know that they must somehow become the words of any who call themselves Christian and take up their own crosses. Christâ€™s Cross is indeed empty, but he wishes us to take it up ourselves. Paradoxically, this sacrifice of the self is the only way to gain our own identities. As Fr. Neuhaus puts it, â€œthe only definition of the self to be trusted is the self that is on the far side of being crucified.â€
The Imaginative Conservative applies the principle of appreciation to the discussion of culture and politicsâ€”we approach dialogue with magnanimity rather than with mere civility. Will you help us remain a refreshing oasis in the increasingly contentious arena of modern discourse? Please consider
donating now.
The featured image is Cristo crucificado en la agonÃ­a (1804), by Felipe AbÃ¡s Aranda after Francisco Goya, and is in the public domain, courtesy of
Wikimedia Commons.jpg).
All comments are moderated and must be civil, concise, and constructive to the conversation. Comments that are critical of an essay may be approved, but comments containing ad hominem criticism of the author will not be published. Also, comments containing web links or block quotations are unlikely to be approved. Keep in mind that essays represent the opinions of the authors and do not necessarily reflect the views of The Imaginative Conservative or its editor or publisher.

author: ANI
title: Rain, hailstorms possibility in five Himachal districts; IMD issues yellow alert | Headlines
text: Rain, hailstorms possibility in five Himachal districts; IMD issues yellow alert Director of India Meteorological Department (IMD) Himachal Pradesh, Surender Paul, said, "The thunderstorms will continue for the next 48 hours in the state. Yesterday, rain and hailstorms were recorded in some parts of Shimla and Kangra districts. Its impact will be on May 12, and some districts like Kangra, Hamirpur, Kullu, and Mandi may receive heavy rainfall." [ANI](/ani-stories)| Updated: 10-05-2024 18:26 IST | Created: 10-05-2024 18:26 IST - Country: - India The Regional Meteorological Centre, Shimla, has issued a yellow alert for rain and hailstorms in five districts of Himachal Pradesh for the next three days from May 11 to 13. The alert has been issued for districts including Kangra, Hamirpur, Shimla, Mandi, and Kullu during the next three days. Temperatures are also expected to drop below normal in the state. Director of India Meteorological Department (IMD) Himachal Pradesh, Surender Paul, said, "The thunderstorms will continue for the next 48 hours in the state. Yesterday, rain and hailstorms were recorded in some parts of Shimla and Kangra districts. Its impact will be on May 12, and some districts like Kangra, Hamirpur, Kullu, and Mandi may receive heavy rainfall." "Hailstorm is also expected in Shimla, Mandi, Kullu, and their surrounding areas. The weather will start improving after May 13; the temperatures will also remain below normal," he said. "The temperatures are not expected to rise, but the humidity level has increased slightly. This is due to the western disturbance; the low-level wind also has an impact. We have issued a yellow alert for May 11, 12, and 13 at the same time from today onwards. The hailstorm warning has also been issued, especially in the district of Shimla," Paul said. Earlier on Monday, Himachal Pradesh RWD predicted light to moderate rain accompanied by thunderstorms and hailstorms at one or two places in 8 districts of the state. Meanwhile, amid the soaring temperature and heatwaves across the nation, including Rajasthan, the Director of the Regional Meteorological Centre in Jaipur, Radhe Shyam Sharma, said that Western Rajasthan is experiencing a severe heatwave, with temperatures exceeding 45 degrees Celsius. He also mentioned that there is some hope for relief in the next day or two due to the Western disturbance. The maximum temperature in Rajasthan is hovering in the range of 43 to 46 degrees Celsius, with Barmer recording the highest temperature of 46 degrees Celsius. Earlier, the Regional Meteorological Centre in Jaipur issued a yellow alert and heatwave warnings when temperatures in various districts crossed the mark of 44 degrees Celsius. (ANI) (This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)
